timeline.message:
DropSchema related changes for issue #1595

This is only a partial fix. More work needs to happen for drop-schema to
work on PostgreSQL.

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

Fix the SQLState for an undefined object name for postgresql

Also added try/catch for dropping undefined indexes

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

Fix the SQLState for an undefined object name for postgresql

Also added try/catch for dropping undefined indexes

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText:
Maybe this should be an OR with
42883 | undefined_function
42P01 | undefined_table
42P02 | undefined_parameter
42704 | undefined_object
timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: empirically I found the 42704 is what we got back for undefined functions, tables, and indexes.  not sure how to reconcile that with the provided list, but its easy-enough for me to or them
replies.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: I wasn't sure if we should or not, it was more of a check-in, not necessarily that we had to or-then
replies.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: ok, i went ahead and added them
replies.author: lmsurpre

timeline.bodyText: is the adminDrop implicit here? what if we just call dropAdmin
timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: dropAdmin is covered separately in the if case just below this
replies.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: I think we should (later) revisit the whole option control logic in this Main...too much entropy.
replies.author: punktilious

replies.bodyText: +1 on Robin's comment.  it's definitely growing
replies.author: prb112

timeline.author: prb112

timeline.message:
Warn and skip drop permission statements for postgresql

Permission objects are not used in our use of PostgreSQL

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

Added additional codes for isUndefined

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>
